title: Torque and alpha - alpha for 2 blocks-rod systems

content.question: Two blocks, one of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and one of mass <math alttext="3 m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, are attached to the ends of a thin rod of negligible rotational inertia, as shown in the figure. The rod is free to pivot with negligible friction about an axis that is perpendicular to the plane of the figure and passes through the rod’s center. Each block’s center of mass is a distance <math alttext="r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> from the axis, and the blocks are small compared to <math alttext="r sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. The rod is held horizontal and then released from rest. Immediately after release, the angular acceleration of the blocks-rod system is <math alttext="alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The rod is then replaced with a heavy uniform rod that has a rotational inertia <math alttext="m sub 0, end sub, r sub 0, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><msup><msub><mi>r</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></math> about its center. The two blocks are attached to the ends of the second rod, the rod is again held horizontal and released from rest, and the angular acceleration is <math alttext="alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> immediately after the second system is released. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction alpha sub 2 over alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math> ?
